intro: Selinocarpus undulatus, commonly known as the undulating selinocarp, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
